alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Northeast Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 20 at 8:46PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: .Scattered to numerous storms will develop early Friday afternoon over the Sangre de Cristo mountains then slowly drift southeastward through the afternoon and evening hours. Unusually high moisture in the region will lead to locally heavy rainfall with rainfall rates reaching as high as 1.5"/hour. The risk includes the Hermit`s Peak Calf Canyon and Cook`s Peak burn scars as well as the adjacent areas to the east where soils are already saturated. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following areas, in north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. In northeast New Mexico, Far Northeast Highlands and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Unusually high moisture will result in locally heavy rainfall over areas sensitive to flash flooding including recent burn scars. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands; Northeast Highlands; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
